content_1: Officials from Servicio Nacional de Sanidad, Inocuidad y Calidad Agroalimentaria (SENASICA) reported earlier this week that more than one million chickens in the north-central state of Guanajuato were exposed to the deadly bird flu virus. Health authorities have established a quarantine around the 12 affected farms and are vaccinating poultry throughout the state to help prevent further outbreaks. Additionally, the affected farms are being cleaned and disinfected and around 900,000 chickens may be culled in an effort to contain the virus and prevent the disease from spreading further.
content_2: Germanyâ€™s state agriculture ministry recently reported a potential case of H5N1 on a poultry farm in the eastern state of Brandenburg and is awaiting the final test results. All 14,500 at-risk chickens have been culled to help prevent further spread of the virus. The source of this outbreak remains unknown and various controls measures are being applied including quarantine, movement control, screening, disinfection of contaminated areas, and control of wildlife reservoirs.
